metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5098 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when form input elements, focus, and selections are manipulated by script content. This results in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 52.6, Firefox ESR < 52.6, and Firefox < 58.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5098` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

thunderbird - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
